perturbation.original_text: F. You may be required, at AIRSOPURE's sole discretion, to upgrade or remodel Your AIRSOPURE Center to conform to AIRSOPURE's then-current specifications and standards as specified in AIRSOPURE's Operating Manual of otherwise in writing, provided such upgrade or remodel is reasonable in terms of cost and implementation schedule.
perturbation.changed_text: F. You may be required, at AIRSOPURE's sole discretion, to upgrade or remodel Your AIRSOPURE Center to conform to AIRSOPURE's then-current specifications and standards as specified in AIRSOPURE's Operating Manual or otherwise in writing.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'provided such upgrade or remodel is reasonable in terms of cost and implementation schedule,' the franchisee is now vulnerable to unreasonable demands for upgrades. This introduces potential violations of fair franchising practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Business and Commerce Code, Chapter 12, relating to franchise agreements.
perturbation.law_explanation: The modified text removes the constraint that upgrades or remodels must be reasonable in cost and implementation schedule. This contradicts Texas Business & Commerce Code §12.003, which implies a duty of good faith and fair dealing. By potentially requiring unreasonable upgrades, the franchisor could be violating this duty.

Added by Acts 2021, 87th Leg., R.S., Ch. 739 (H.B. 4474 ), Sec. 9, eff. September 1, 2021. Sec. 12.002. SCOPE. This chapter applies to virtual currency. Added by Acts 2021, 87th Leg., R.S., Ch. 739 (H.B. 4474 ), Sec. 9, eff. September 1, 2021. Sec. 12.003. RIGHTS IN VIRTUAL CURRENCY. (a) In this section: (1) "Adverse claim" means a claim that a claimant has a property interest in a virtual currency and that it is a violation of the rights of the claimant for another person to hold, transfer, or deal with the virtual currency. (2) "Qualifying purchaser" means a purchaser that obtains control of a virtual currency for value and without notice of any adverse claim. (b) Subject to Subsections (c) through (h), law other than this chapter determines whether a person acquires rights in a virtual currency and the rights that the person acquires. (c) A

perturbation.original_text:
11. INSURANCE
11.01. You shall procure and maintain in full force and effect during the term of this Agreement, at Your expense, insurance policies written by an insurance company satisfactory to AIRSOPURE in accordance with standards and specifications set forth in the Operations Manual or otherwise by AIRSOPURE in writing. Such policies shall name AIRSOPURE as an additional insured and shall include, at a minimum:
A. Comprehensive general liability insurance in the amount of $1,000,000.00.
B. Comprehensive automobile liability insurance, including collision, comprehensive, medical and liability to satisfy state law requirements.
C. Additional coverage's and higher policy limits may be required from time to time by AIRSOPURE.
11.02. At least 7 days prior to the opening of the Center and on each policy renewal date thereafter, You shall submit to AIRSOPURE copies of all policies and policy amendments. The evidence of insurance shall include a statement by the insurer that the policy or policies will not be canceled or materially altered without at least 30 days prior written notice to AIRSOPURE.
perturbation.changed_text:
11. INSURANCE
11.01. You shall procure and maintain in full force and effect during the term of this Agreement, at Your expense, insurance policies written by an insurance company satisfactory to AIRSOPURE in accordance with standards and specifications set forth in the Operations Manual or otherwise by AIRSOPURE in writing. Such policies shall name AIRSOPURE as an additional insured.
B. Comprehensive automobile liability insurance, including collision, comprehensive, medical and liability to satisfy state law requirements.
C. Additional coverage's and higher policy limits may be required from time to time by AIRSOPURE.
11.02. At least 7 days prior to the opening of the Center and on each policy renewal date thereafter, You shall submit to AIRSOPURE copies of all policies and policy amendments. The evidence of insurance shall include a statement by the insurer that the policy or policies will not be canceled or materially altered without at least 30 days prior written notice to AIRSOPURE.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the requirement for 'Comprehensive general liability insurance in the amount of $1,000,000.00' weakens the franchisee's insurance obligations. This could be problematic, especially in Texas, where businesses are expected to carry adequate insurance coverage to cover potential liabilities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas law requires businesses to carry adequate insurance to protect against liabilities.
perturbation.law_citation: Varies depending on the specific industry, but general business liability is expected.
perturbation.law_url: N/A - General principle; specific requirements vary by industry and activity.
perturbation.law_explanation: The omission contradicts the general principle of carrying sufficient liability insurance to cover business risks. While there's no single statute mandating a specific amount for every business, the absence of a defined minimum in the contract creates a situation where the franchisee may be underinsured, potentially violating implicit legal expectations and increasing the risk of legal action against both the franchisee and, potentially, the franchisor. Although not explicitly breaking a specific law, it ignores a key principle of risk management and compliance that is implicit in business regulations.

perturbation.original_text: 18.07. This Agreement takes effect upon its acceptance and execution by AIRSOPURE in the State of Texas, and shall be interpreted and construed under the laws of the State of Texas.
perturbation.changed_text: 18.07. This Agreement takes effect upon its acceptance and execution by AIRSOPURE, and shall be interpreted and construed under the laws of [COUNTRY X].
perturbation.explanation: Changing the governing law from Texas to a hypothetical 'Country X' that has weaker consumer protection laws, or does not recognize franchise law, removes protections afforded to the franchisee under Texas law. This is a form of omission because it effectively omits the benefits of Texas law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Business and Commerce Code, Chapter 12, relating to franchise agreements.
perturbation.law_citation: Texas Business & Commerce Code §12.001 et seq.
perturbation.law_explanation: By changing the governing law, the franchisee loses the protections offered by the Texas Business and Commerce Code regarding franchise agreements, including the implied duty of good faith and restrictions on unfair practices. This effectively omits these protections, disadvantaging the franchisee if Country X lacks similar laws.
perturbation.scraped_snippet: ï»¿ BUSINESS AND COMMERCE CODE CHAPTER 12. VIRTUAL CURRENCY BUSINESS AND COMMERCE CODE TITLE 1. UNIFORM COMMERCIAL CODE CHAPTER 12. VIRTUAL CURRENCY Sec. 12.001. DEFINITION. In this chapter, "virtual currency": (1) means a digital representation of value that: (A) is used as a medium of exchange, unit of account, or store of value; and (B) is not legal tender, whether or not denominated in legal tender; and (2) does not include: (A) a transaction in which a merchant grants, as part of an affinity or rewards program, value that cannot be taken from or exchanged with the merchant for legal tender, bank credit, or virtual currency; or (B) a digital representation of value issued by or on behalf of a publisher and used solely within an online game, game
